name: Acid Burrower
descr: A horse-sized insect with digging claws and acidic blood.

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Burrower can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Earth Eruption
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to have the Burrower burst out of the ground. All creatures within Very Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or be knocked over, making them *Vulnerable* until they next act.

features.name: Spit Acid
features.text: Make an attack against all targets in front of the Burrower within Close range. Targets the Burrower succeeds against take **2d6** physical damage and must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Acid Bath
features.text: When the Burrower takes Severe damage, all creatures within Close range are bathed in their acidic blood, taking **1d10** physical damage. This splash covers the ground within Very Close range with blood, and all creatures other than the Burrower who move through it take **1d6** physical damage.

name: Archer Guard
descr: A tall guard bearing a longbow and quiver with arrows fletched in the settlement's colors.

data.motivesAndTactics: Arrest, close gates, make it through the day, pin down

features.name: Hobbling Shot
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, **mark a Stress** to deal **1d12+3** physical damage. If the target marks HP from this attack, they have disadvantage on Agility Rolls until they clear at least 1 HP.

name: Bear
descr: A large bear with thick fur and powerful claws.

features.name: Overwhelming Force
features.text: Targets who mark HP from the Bear's standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

features.name: Bite
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal **3d4+10** physical damage and the target is *Restrained* until they break free with a successful Strength Roll.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Bear makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Bladed Guard
descr: An armored guard bearing a sword and shield painted in the settlement's colors.

data.motivesAndTactics: Arrest, close gates, make it through the day, pin down

features.name: Shield Wall
features.text: A creature who tries to move within Very Close range of the Guard must succeed on an Agility Roll. If additional Bladed Guards are standing in a line alongside the first, and each is within Melee range of another guard in the line, the Difficulty increases by the total number of guards in that line.

features.name: Detain
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, **mark a Stress** to *Restrain* the target until they break free with a successful attack, Finesse Roll, or Strength Roll.

name: Brawny Zombie
descr: A large corpse, decay-bloated and angry.

features.name: Slow
features.text: When you spotlight the Zombie and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Zombie and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Rend Asunder
features.text: Make a standard attack with advantage against a target the Zombie has *Restrained*. On a success, the attack deals direct damage.

features.name: Rip and Tear
features.text: When the Zombies makes a successful standard attack, you can **mark a Stress** to temporarily *Restrain* the target and force them to mark 2 Stress.

name: Cave Ogre
descr: A massive humanoid who sees all sapient life as food.

data.motivesAndTactics: Bite off heads, feast, rip limbs, stomp, throw enemies

features.name: Ramp Up
features.text: You must **spend a Fear** to spotlight the Ogre. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

features.name: Bone Breaker
features.text: The Ogre's attacks deal direct damage.

features.name: Hail of Boulders
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to pick up heavy objects and throw them at all targets in front of the Ogre within Far range. Make an attack against these targets. Targets the Ogre succeeds against take **1d10+2** physical damage. If they succeed against more than one target, you gain a Fear.

features.name: Rampaging Fury
features.text: When the Ogre marks 2 or more HP, they can rampage. Move the Ogre to a point within Close range and deal **2d6+3** direct physical damage to all targets in their path.

name: Construct
descr: A roughly humanoid being of stone and steel, assembled and animated by magic.

data.motivesAndTactics: Destroy environment, serve creator, smash target, trample groups

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Construct can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Weak Structure
features.text: When the Construct marks HP from physical damage, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Trample
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make an attack against all targets in the Construct's path when they move. Targets the Construct succeeds against take **1d8** physical damage.

features.name: Overload
features.text: Before rolling damage for the Construct's attack, you can **mark a Stress** to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll. The Construct can then take the spotlight again.

features.name: Death Quake
features.text: When the Construct marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Construct succeeds against take **1d12+2** magic damage.

name: Courtier
descr: An ambitious and ostentatiously dressed socialite.

features.name: Mockery
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to say something mocking and force a target within Close range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (14) to see if they can save face. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is *Vulnerable* until the scene ends.

features.name: Scapegoat
features.text: **Spend a Fear** and target a PC. The Courtier convinces a crowd or prominent individual that the target is the cause of their current conflict or misfortune.

name: Deeproot Defender
descr: A burly vegetable-person with grasping vines.

features.name: Ground Slam
features.text: Slam the ground, knocking all targets within Very Close range back to Far range. Each target knocked back this way must mark a Stress.

features.name: Grab and Drag
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Close range. On a success, **spend a Fear** to pull them into Melee range, deal **1d6+2** physical damage, and *Restrain* them until the Defender takes Severe damage.

name: Dire Wolf
descr: A large wolf with menacing teeth, seldom encountered alone.

data.motivesAndTactics: Defend territory, harry, protect pack, surround, trail

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.text: If the Wolf makes a successful standard attack and another Dire Wolf is within Melee range of the target, deal **1d6+5** physical damage instead of their standard damage and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Hobbling Strike
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal **3d4+10** direct physical damage and make them *Vulnerable* until they clear at least 1 HP.

name: Giant Mosquitoes
descr: Dozens of fist-sized mosquitoes, flying together for protection.

features.name: Horde (1d4+1)
features.text: When the Mosquitoes have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **1d4+1** physical damage instead.

features.name: Flying
features.text: While flying, the Mosquitoes have a +2 bonus to their Difficulty.

features.name: Bloodsucker
features.text: When the Mosquitoes' attack causes a target to mark HP, you can **mark a Stress** to force the target to mark an additional HP.

name: Giant Rat
descr: A cat-sized rodent skilled at scavenging and survival.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Rat is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Rat, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Rats within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 1 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Giant Scorpion
descr: A human-sized insect with tearing claws and a stinging tail.

features.name: Double Strike
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make a standard attack against two targets within Melee range.

features.name: Venomous Stinger
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, **spend a Fear** to deal **1d4+4** physical damage and *Poison* them until their next rest or they succeed on a Knowledge Roll (16). While *Poisoned*, the target must roll a **d6** before they make an action roll. On a result of 4 or lower, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Scorpion makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Glass Snake
descr: A clear serpent with a massive head that leaves behind a glass shard trail wherever they go.

features.name: Armor-Shredding Shards
features.text: On a successful attack within Melee range against the Snake, the attacker must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Spinning Serpent
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Snake succeeds against take **1d6+1** physical damage.

features.name: Spitter
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to introduce a **d6** Spitter Die. When the Snake is in the spotlight, roll this die. On a result of 5 or higher, all targets in front of the Snake within Far range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take **1d4** physical damage. The Snake can take the spotlight a second time this GM turn.

name: Green Ooze
descr: A moving mound of translucent green slime.

data.motivesAndTactics: Camouflage, consume and multiply, creep up, envelop

features.name: Slow
features.text: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Acidic Form
features.text: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Envelop
features.text: Make a standard attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. The target must mark an additional Stress when they make an action roll. If the Ooze takes Severe damage, the target is freed.

features.name: Split
features.text: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can **spend a Fear** to split them into two Tiny Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

name: Harrier
descr: A nimble fighter armed with javelins.

features.name: Maintain Distance
features.text: After making a standard attack, the Harrier can move anywhere within Far range.

features.name: Fall Back
features.text: When a creature moves into Melee range to make an attack, you can **mark a Stress** before the attack roll to move anywhere within Close range and make an attack against that creature. On a success, deal **1d10+2** physical damage.

name: Head Guard
descr: A seasoned guard with a mace, a whistle, and a bellowing voice.

data.motivesAndTactics: Arrest, close gates, pin down, seek glory

features.name: Rally Guards
features.text: **Spend 2 Fear** to spotlight the Head Guard and up to **2d4** allies within Far range.

features.name: On My Signal
features.text: Countdown (5). When the Head Guard is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. It ticks down when a PC makes an attack roll. When it triggers, all Archer Guards within Far range make a standard attack with advantage against the nearest target within their range. If any attacks succeed on the same target, combine their damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Head Guard makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Jagged Knife Bandit
descr: A cunning criminal in a cloak bearing one of the gang's iconic knives.

features.name: Climber
features.text: The Bandit climbs just as easily as they run.

features.name: From Above
features.text: When the Bandit succeeds on a standard attack from above a target, they deal **1d10+1** physical damage instead of their standard damage.

name: Jagged Knife Hexer
descr: A staff-wielding bandit in a cloak adorned with magical paraphernalia, using curses to vex their foes.

features.name: Curse
features.text: Choose a target within Far range and temporarily *Curse* them. While the target is *Cursed*, you can **mark a Stress** when that target rolls with Hope to make the roll be with Fear instead.

features.name: Chaotic Flux
features.text: Make an attack against up to three targets within Very Close range. **Mark a Stress** to deal **2d6+3** magic damage to targets the Hexer succeeded against.

name: Jagged Knife Kneebreaker
descr: An imposing brawler carrying a large club.

features.name: I've Got 'Em
features.text: Creatures *Restrained* by the Kneebreaker take double damage from attacks by other adversaries.

features.name: Hold Them Down
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the target takes no damage but is *Restrained* and *Vulnerable*. The target can break free, clearing both conditions, with a successful Strength Roll or is freed automatically if the Kneebreaker takes Major or greater damage.

name: Jagged Knife Lackey
descr: A thief with simple clothes and small daggers, eager to prove themselves.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Lackey is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Lackey, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Jagged Knife Lackeys within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Jagged Knife Lieutenant
descr: A seasoned bandit in quality leathers with a strong voice and cunning eyes.

features.name: Tactician
features.text: When you spotlight the Lieutenant, **mark a Stress** to also spotlight two allies within Close range.

features.name: More Where That Came From
features.text: Summon three Jagged Knife Lackeys, who appear at Far range.

features.name: Coup de Grace
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to make an attack against a *Vulnerable* target within Close range. On a success, deal **2d6+12** physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Lieutenant makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Jagged Knife Shadow
descr: A nimble scoundrel bearing a wicked knife and utilizing shadow magic to isolate targets.

features.name: Backstab
features.text: When the Shadow succeeds on a standard attack that has advantage, they deal **1d6+6** physical damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Cloaked
features.text: Become *Hidden* until after the Shadow's next attack. Attacks made while *Hidden* from this feature have advantage.

name: Jagged Knife Sniper
descr: A lanky bandit striking from cover with a shortbow.

features.name: Unseen Strike
features.text: If the Sniper is *Hidden* when they make a successful standard attack against a target, they deal **1d10+4** physical damage instead of their standard damage.

name: Merchant
descr: A finely dressed trader with a keen eye for financial gain.

data.motivesAndTactics: Buy low and sell high, create demand, inflate prices, seek profit

features.name: Preferential Treatment
features.text: A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll against the Merchant gains a discount on purchases. A PC who fails on a Presence Roll against the Merchant must pay more and has disadvantage on future Presence Rolls against the Merchant.

features.name: The Runaround
features.text: When a PC rolls a 14 or lower on a Presence Roll made against the Merchant, they must mark a Stress.

name: Minor Chaos Elemental
descr: A coruscating mass of uncontrollable magic.

features.name: Arcane Form
features.text: The Elemental is resistant to magic damage.

features.name: Sickening Flux
features.text: Mark a **HP** to force all targets within Close range to mark a Stress and become *Vulnerable* until their next rest or they clear a HP.

features.name: Remake Reality
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to transform the area within Very Close range into a different biome. All targets within this area take **2d6+3** direct magic damage.

features.name: Magical Reflection
features.text: When the Elemental takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal an amount of damage to the attacker equal to half the damage they dealt.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Minor Demon
descr: A crimson-hued creature from the Circles Below, consumed by rage against all mortals.

data.motivesAndTactics: Act erratically, corral targets, relish pain, torment

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Demon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: All Must Fall
features.text: When a PC rolls a failure with Fear while within Close range of the Demon, they lose a Hope.

features.name: Hellfire
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to rain down hellfire within Far range. All targets within the area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take **1d20+3** magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Reaper
features.text: Before rolling damage for the Demon's attack, you can **mark a Stress** to gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to the Demon's current number of marked HP.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Minor Fire Elemental
descr: A living flame the size of a large bonfire.

data.motivesAndTactics: Encircle enemies, grow in size, intimidate, start fires

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Elemental can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Scorched Earth
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to choose a point within Far range. The ground within Very Close range of that point immediately bursts into flames. All creatures within this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take **2d8** magic damage from the flames. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Explosion
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to erupt in a fiery explosion. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against take **1d8** magic damage and are knocked back to Far range.

features.name: Consume Kindling
features.text: Three times per scene, when the Elemental moves onto objects that are highly flammable, consume them to clear a HP or a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Minor Treant
descr: An ambulatory sapling rising up to defend their forest.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Treant is defeated when they take any damage. For every 5 damage a PC deals to the Treant, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Minor Treants within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Patchwork Zombie Hulk
descr: A towering gestalt of corpses moving as one, with torso-sized limbs and fists as large as a grown halfling.

features.name: Destructible
features.text: When the Zombie takes Major or greater damage, they mark an additional HP.

features.name: Flailing Limbs
features.text: When the Zombie makes a standard attack, they can attack all targets within Very Close range.

features.name: Another for the Pile
features.text: When the Zombie is within Very Close range of a corpse, they can incorporate it into themselves, clearing a HP and a Stress.

features.name: Tormented Screams
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to cause all PCs within Far range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail lose a Hope and you gain a Fear for each. Targets who succeed must mark a Stress.

name: Petty Noble
descr: A richly dressed and adorned aristocrat brimming with hubris.

data.motivesAndTactics: Abuse power, gather resources, mobilize minions

features.name: My Land, My Rules
features.text: All social actions made against the Noble on their land have disadvantage.

features.name: Guards, Seize Them!
features.text: Once per scene, **mark a Stress** to summon **1d4** Bladed Guards, who appear at Far range to enforce the Noble's will.

features.name: Exile
features.text: **Spend a Fear** and target a PC. The Noble proclaims that the target and their allies are exiled from the noble's territory. While exiled, the target and their allies have disadvantage during social situations within the Noble's domain.

name: Pirate Captain
descr: A charismatic sea dog with an impressive hat, eager to raid and plunder.

data.motivesAndTactics: Command, make 'em walk the plank, plunder, raid

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.text: When the Captain marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

features.name: Reinforcements
features.text: Once per scene, **mark a Stress** to summon a Pirate Raiders Horde, which appears at Far range.

features.name: No Quarter
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target who has three or more Pirates within Melee range of them. The Captain leads the Pirates in hurling threats and promises of a watery grave. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target marks **1d4+1** Stress. On a success, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Captain makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Pirate Raiders
descr: Seafaring scoundrels moving in a ravaging pack.

features.name: Horde (1d4+1)
features.text: When the Raiders have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **1d4+1** physical damage instead.

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.text: When the Raiders mark 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

name: Pirate Tough
descr: A thickly muscled and tattooed pirate with melon-sized fists.

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.text: When the Tough marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

features.name: Clear the Decks
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, **mark a Stress** to move into Melee range of the target, dealing **3d4** physical damage and knocking the target back to Close range.

name: Red Ooze
descr: A moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.

data.motivesAndTactics: Camouflage, consume and multiply, ignite, start fires

features.name: Creeping Fire
features.text: The Ooze can only move within Very Close range as their normal movement. They light any flammable object they touch on fire.

features.name: Ignite
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target takes **1d8** magic damage and is *Ignited* until they're extinguished with a successful Finesse Roll (14). While *Ignited*, the target takes **1d4** magic damage when they make an action roll.

features.name: Split
features.text: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can **spend a Fear** to split them into two Tiny Red Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

name: Rotted Zombie
descr: A decaying corpse ambling toward their prey.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Zombie is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Zombie, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Rotted Zombies within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Sellsword
descr: An armed mercenary testing their luck.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Sellsword is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Sellsword, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Sellswords within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 3 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Shambling Zombie
descr: An animated corpse that moves shakily, driven only by hunger.

data.motivesAndTactics: Devour, hungry, mob enemy, shred flesh

features.name: Too Many to Handle
features.text: When the Zombie is within Melee range of a creature and at least one other Zombie is within Close range, all attacks against that creature have advantage.

features.name: Horrifying
features.text: Targets who mark HP from the Zombie's attacks must also mark a Stress.

name: Skeleton Archer
descr: A fragile skeleton with a shortbow and arrows.

data.motivesAndTactics: Perforate distracted targets, play dead, steal skin

features.name: Opportunist
features.text: When two or more adversaries are within Very Close range of a creature, all damage the Archer deals to that creature is doubled.

features.name: Deadly Shot
features.text: Make an attack against a *Vulnerable* target within Far range. On a success, **mark a Stress** to deal **3d4+8** physical damage.

name: Skeleton Dredge
descr: A clattering pile of bones.

data.motivesAndTactics: Fall apart, overwhelm, play dead, steal skin

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Dredge is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Dredge, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Dredges within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 1 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Skeleton Knight
descr: A large armored skeleton with a huge blade.

data.motivesAndTactics: Cut down the living, steal skin, wreak havoc

features.name: Terrifying
features.text: When the Knight makes a successful attack, all PCs within Close range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Cut to the Bone
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Knight succeeds against take **1d8+2** physical damage and must mark a Stress.

features.name: Dig Two Graves
features.text: When the Knight is defeated, they make an attack against a target within Very Close range (prioritizing the creature who killed them). On a success, the target takes **1d4+8** physical damage and loses **1d4** Hope.

name: Skeleton Warrior
descr: A dirt-covered skeleton armed with a rusted blade.

data.motivesAndTactics: Feign death, gang up, steal skin

features.name: Only Bones
features.text: The Warrior is resistant to physical damage.

features.name: Won't Stay Dead
features.text: When the Warrior is defeated, you can spotlight them and roll a **d6**. On a result of 6, if there are other adversaries on the battlefield, the Warrior re-forms with no marked HP.

name: Spellblade
descr: A mercenary combining swordplay and magic to deadly effect.

features.name: Arcane Steel
features.text: Damage dealt by the Spellblade's standard attack is considered both physical and magic.

features.name: Suppressing Blast
features.text: Mark a **Stress** and target a group within Far range. All targets must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take **1d8+2** magic damage. You gain a Fear for each target who marked HP from this attack.

features.name: Move as a Unit
features.text: **Spend 2 Fear** to spotlight up to five allies within Far range.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Spellblade makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Swarm Of Rats
descr: A skittering mass of ordinary rodents moving as one like a ravenous wave.

features.name: Horde (1d4+1)
features.text: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **1d4+1** physical damage instead.

features.name: In Your Face
features.text: All targets within Melee range have disadvantage on attacks against targets other than the Swarm.

name: Sylvan Soldier
descr: A faerie warrior adorned in armor made of leaves and bark.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.text: If the Soldier makes a standard attack and another Sylvan Soldier is within Melee range of the target, deal **1d8+5** physical damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Forest Control
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to pull down a tree within Close range. A creature hit by the tree must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (15) or take **1d10** physical damage.

features.name: Blend In
features.text: When the Soldier makes a successful attack, you can **mark a Stress** to become *Hidden* until the Soldier's next attack or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll (14) to find them.

name: Tangle Bramble
descr: An animate, blood-drinking tumbleweed.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Bramble is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Tangle Bramble, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Tangle Brambles within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

features.name: Drain and Multiply
features.text: When an attack from the Bramble causes a target to mark HP and there are three or more Tangle Bramble Minions within Close range, you can combine the Minions into a Tangle Bramble Swarm Horde. The Horde's HP is equal to the number of Minions combined.

name: Tangle Bramble Swarm
descr: A cluster of animate, blood-drinking tumbleweeds, each the size of a large gourd.

features.name: Horde (1d4+2)
features.text: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **1d4+2** physical damage instead.

features.name: Crush
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to deal **2d6+8** direct physical damage to a target with 3 or more bramble tokens.

features.name: Encumber
features.text: When the Swarm succeeds on an attack, give the target a bramble token. If a target has any bramble tokens, they are *Restrained*. If a target has 3 or more bramble tokens, they are also *Vulnerable*. All bramble tokens can be removed by succeeding on a Finesse Roll (12 + the number of bramble tokens) or dealing Major or greater damage to the Swarm. If bramble tokens are removed from a target using a Finesse Roll, a number of Tangle Bramble Minions spawn within Melee range equal to the number of tokens removed.

name: Tiny Green Ooze
descr: A small moving mound of translucent green slime.

features.name: Acidic Form
features.text: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

name: Tiny Red Ooze
descr: A small moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.

features.name: Burning
features.text: When a creature within Melee range deals damage to the Ooze, they take **1d6** direct magic damage.

name: Young Dryad
descr: An imperious tree-person leading their forest's defenses.

features.name: Voice of the Forest
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to spotlight **1d4** allies within range of a target they can attack without moving. On a success, their attacks deal half damage.

features.name: Thorny Cage
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to form a cage around a target within Very Close range and *Restrain* them until they're freed with a successful Strength Roll. When a creature makes an action roll against the cage, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Dryad makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Zombie Pack
descr: A group of shambling corpses instinctively moving together.

features.name: Horde (1d4+2)
features.text: When the Zombies have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **1d4+2** physical damage instead.

features.name: Overwhelm
features.text: When the Zombies mark HP from an attack within Melee range, you can **mark a Stress** to make a standard attack against the attacker.

name: Apprentice Assassin
descr: A young trainee eager to prove themselves.

data.motivesAndTactics: Act reckless, kill, prove their worth, show off

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Assassin is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Assassin, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Apprentice Assassins within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Archer Squadron
descr: A group of trained archers bearing massive bows.

features.name: Horde (1d6+3)
features.text: When the Squadron has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **1d6+3** physical damage instead.

features.name: Focused Volley
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to target a point within Far range. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Close range of that point. Targets the Squadron succeeds against take **1d10+4** physical damage.

features.name: Suppressing Fire
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to target a point within Far range. Until the next roll with Fear, a creature who moves within Close range of that point must make an Agility Reaction Roll. On a failure, they take **2d6+3** physical damage. On a success, they take half damage.

name: Assassin Poisoner
descr: A cunning scoundrel skilled in both poisons and ambushing.

data.motivesAndTactics: Anticipate, get paid, kill, taint food and water

features.name: Grindletooth Venom
features.text: Targets who mark HP from the Assassin's attacks are *Vulnerable* until they clear a HP.

features.name: Out of Nowhere
features.text: The Assassin has advantage on attacks if they are *Hidden*.

features.name: Fumigation
features.text: Drop a smoke bomb that fills the air within Close range with smoke, *Dizzying* all targets in this area. *Dizzied* targets have disadvantage on their next action roll, then clear the condition.

name: Battle Box
descr: A cube-shaped construct with a different rune on each of their six sides.

data.motivesAndTactics: Change tactics, trample foes, wait in disguise

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Box can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Randomized Tactics
features.text:
Mark a **Stress** and roll a **d6**. The Box uses the corresponding move:
- 1. **Mana Beam**. The Box fires a searing beam. Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, deal **2d10+2** magic damage.
- 2. **Fire Jets**. The Box shoots into the air, spinning and releasing jets of flame. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take **2d8** physical damage.
- 3. **Trample**. The Box rockets around erratically. Make an attack against all PCs within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take **1d6+5** physical damage and are *Vulnerable* until their next roll with Hope.
- 4. **Shocking Gas**. The Box sprays out a silver gas sparking with lightning. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll or mark 3 Stress.
- 5. **Stunning Clap**. The Box leaps and their sides clap, creating a small sonic boom. All targets within Very Close range must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll or become *Vulnerable* until the cube is defeated.
- 6. **Psionic Whine**. The Box releases a cluster of mechanical bees whose buzz rattles mortal minds. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll or take **2d4+9** direct magic damage.

features.name: Overcharge
features.text: Before rolling damage for the Box's attack, you can **mark a Stress** to add a **d6** to the damage roll. Additionally, you gain a Fear.

features.name: Death Quake
features.text: When the Box marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or take **2d8+1** magic damage.

name: Chaos Skull
descr: A floating humanoid skull animated by scintillating magic.

features.name: Levitation
features.text: The Skull levitates several feet off the ground and can't be *Restrained*.

features.name: Wards
features.text: The Skull is resistant to magic damage.

features.name: Magic Burst
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Skull succeeds against take **2d6+4** magic damage.

features.name: Siphon Magic
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to make an attack against a PC with a Spellcast trait within Very Close range. On a success, the target marks **1d4** Stress and the Skull clears that many Stress. Additionally, on a success, the Skull can immediately be spotlighted again.

name: Conscript
descr: A poorly trained civilian pressed into war.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Conscript is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Conscript, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Conscripts within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 6 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Courtesan
descr: An accomplished manipulator and master of the social arts.

features.name: Searing Glance
features.text: When a PC within Close range makes a Presence Roll, you can **mark a Stress** to cast a gaze toward the aftermath. On the target's failure, they must mark 2 Stress and are *Vulnerable* until the scene ends or they succeed on a social action against the Courtesan. On the target's success, they must mark a Stress.

name: Cult Adept
descr: An experienced mage wielding shadow and fear.

data.motivesAndTactics: Curry favor, hinder foes, uncover knowledge

features.name: Enervating Blast
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to make a standard attack against a target within range. On a success, the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Shroud of the Fallen
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to wrap an ally within Close range in a shroud of *Protection* until the Adept marks their last HP. While *Protected*, the target has resistance to all damage.

features.name: Shadow Shackles
features.text: **Spend a Fear** and choose a point within Far range. All targets within Close range of that point are *Restrained* in smoky chains until they break free with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll. A target *Restrained* by this feature must spend a Hope to make an action roll.

features.name: Fear Is Fuel
features.text: Twice per scene, when a PC rolls a failure with Fear, clear a Stress.

name: Cult Fang
descr: A professional killer-turned-cultist.

data.motivesAndTactics: Capture sacrifices, isolate prey, rise in the ranks

features.name: Shadow's Embrace
features.text: The Fang can climb and walk on vertical surfaces. **Mark a Stress** to move from one shadow to another within Far range.

features.name: Pick Off the Straggler
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to cause a target within Melee range to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is teleported with the Fang to a shadow within Far range, making them temporarily *Vulnerable*. On a success, the target must mark a Stress.

name: Cult Initiate
descr: A low-ranking cultist in simple robes, eager to gain power.

data.motivesAndTactics: Follow orders, gain power, seek forbidden knowledge

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Initiate is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Initiate, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Cult Initiates within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Demonic Hound Pack
descr: Unnatural hounds lit from within by hellfire.

data.motivesAndTactics: Cause fear, consume flesh, please masters

features.name: Horde (2d4+1)
features.text: When the Pack has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **2d4+1** physical damage instead.

features.name: Dreadhowl
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make all targets within Very Close range lose a Hope. If a target is not able to lose a Hope, they must instead mark 2 Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Pack makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Electric Eels
descr: A swarm of eels that encircle and electrocute.

data.motivesAndTactics: Avoid larger predators, shock prey, tear apart

features.name: Horde (2d4+1)
features.text: When the Eels have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals **2d4+1** physical damage instead.

features.name: Paralyzing Shock
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. You gain a Fear for each target that marks HP.

name: Elite Soldier
descr: An armored squire or experienced commoner looking to advance.

data.motivesAndTactics: Gain glory, keep order, make alliances

features.name: Reinforce
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to move into Melee range of an ally and make a standard attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal **2d10+2** physical damage and the ally can clear a Stress.

features.name: Vassal's Loyalty
features.text: When the Soldier is within Very Close range of a knight or other noble who would take damage, you can **mark a Stress** to move into Melee range of them and take the damage instead.

name: Failed Experiment
descr: A magical necromantic experiment gone wrong, leaving them warped and ungainly.

features.name: Warped Fortitude
features.text: The Experiment is resistant to physical damage.

features.name: Overwhelm
features.text: When a target the Experiment attacks has other adversaries within Very Close range, the Experiment deals double damage.

features.name: Lurching Lunge
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to spotlight the Experiment as an additional GM move instead of spending Fear.

name: Giant Beastmaster
descr: A leather-clad warrior bearing a whip and massive bow.

data.motivesAndTactics: Command, make a living, maneuver, pin down, protect companion animals

features.name: Two as One
features.text: When the Beastmaster is spotlighted, you can also spotlight a Tier 1 animal adversary currently under their control.

features.name: Pinning Strike
features.text: Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, you can **mark a Stress** to pin them to a nearby surface. The pinned target is *Restrained* until they break free with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll.

features.name: Deadly Companion
features.text: Twice per scene, summon a Bear, Dire Wolf, or similar Tier 1 animal adversary under the Beastmaster's control. The adversary appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.

name: Giant Brawler
descr: An especially muscular giant wielding a warhammer larger than a human.

data.motivesAndTactics: Make a living, overwhelm, slam, topple

features.name: Battering Ram
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to have the Brawler charge at an inanimate object within Close range they could feasibly smash (such as a wall, cart, or market stand) and destroy it. All targets within Very Close range of the object must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take **2d4+3** physical damage from the shrapnel.

features.name: Bloody Reprisal
features.text: When the Brawler marks 2 or more HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can make a standard attack against the attacker. On a success, the Brawler deals **2d6+15** physical damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Brawler makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Giant Eagle
descr: A giant bird of prey with blood-stained talons.

data.motivesAndTactics: Hunt prey, stay mobile, strike decisively

features.name: Flight
features.text: While flying, the Eagle gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

features.name: Deadly Dive
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to attack a target within Far range. On a success, deal **2d10+2** physical damage and knock the target over, making them *Vulnerable* until they next act.

features.name: Take Off
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal **2d4+3** physical damage and the target must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or become temporarily *Restrained* within the Eagle's massive talons. If the target is *Restrained*, the Eagle immediately lifts into the air to Very Far range above the battlefield while holding them.

features.name: Deadly Drop
features.text: While flying, the Eagle can drop a *Restrained* target they are holding. When dropped, the target is no longer *Restrained* but starts falling. If their fall isn't prevented during the PCs' next action, the target takes **2d20** physical damage when they land.

name: Giant Recruit
descr: A giant fighter wearing borrowed armor.

data.motivesAndTactics: Batter, make a living, overwhelm, terrify

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Recruit is defeated when they take any damage. For every 7 damage a PC deals to the Recruit, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Recruits within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Gorgon
descr: A snake-headed, scaled humanoid with a gilded bow, enraged that their peace has been disturbed.

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Gorgon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Sunsear Arrows
features.text: When the Gorgon makes a successful standard attack, the target *Glows* until the end of the scene and can't become *Hidden*. Attack rolls made against a *Glowing* target have advantage.

features.name: Crown of Serpents
features.text: Make an attack roll against a target within Melee range using the Gorgon's protective snakes. On a success, **mark a Stress** to deal **2d10+4** physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Petrifying Gaze
features.text: When the Gorgon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can **spend a Fear** to force the attacker to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they begin to turn to stone, marking a HP and starting a Petrification Countdown (4). This countdown ticks down when the Gorgon is attacked. When it triggers, the target must make a death move. If the Gorgon is defeated, all petrification countdowns end.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Gorgon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Juvenile Flickerfly
descr: A horse-sized insect with iridescent scales and crystalline wings moving faster than the eye can see.

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Peerless Accuracy
features.text: Before the Flickerfly makes an attack, roll a **d6**. On a result of 4 or higher, the target's Evasion is halved against this attack.

features.name: Mind Dance
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target's fears.

features.name: Hallucinatory Breath
features.text: Countdown (Loop **1d6**). When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail must mark a Stress and lose a Hope.

name: Knight Of The Realm
descr: A decorated soldier with heavy armor and a powerful steed.

data.motivesAndTactics: Run down, seek glory, show dominance

features.name: Chevalier
features.text: While the Knight is on a mount, they gain a +2 bonus to their Difficulty. When they take Severe damage, they're knocked from their mount and lose this benefit until they're next spotlighted.

features.name: Heavily Armored
features.text: When the Knight takes physical damage, reduce it by 3.

features.name: Cavalry Charge
features.text: If the Knight is mounted, move up to Far range and make a standard attack against a target. On a success, deal **2d8+4** physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: For the Realm!
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to spotlight **1d4+1** allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

name: Masked Thief
descr: A cunning thief with acrobatic skill and a flair for the dramatic.

features.name: Quick Hands
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal **1d8+2** physical damage and the Thief steals one item or consumable from the target's inventory.

features.name: Escape Plan
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to reveal a snare trap set anywhere on the battlefield by the Thief. All targets within Very Close range of the trap must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be pulled off their feet and suspended upside down. A target is *Restrained* and *Vulnerable* until they break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll (13).

name: Master Assassin
descr: A seasoned killer with a threatening voice and a deadly blade.

data.motivesAndTactics: Ambush, get out alive, kill, prepare for all scenarios

features.name: Won't See It Coming
features.text: The Assassin deals direct damage while they're *Hidden*.

features.name: Strike as One
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to spotlight a number of other Assassins equal to the Assassin's unmarked Stress.

features.name: The Subtle Blade
features.text: When the Assassin successfully makes a standard attack against a *Vulnerable* target, you can **spend a Fear** to deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Assassin makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Merchant Baron
descr: An accomplished merchant with a large operation under their command.

data.motivesAndTactics: Abuse power, gather resources, mobilize minions

features.name: Everyone Has a Price
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to offer a target a dangerous bargain for something they want or need. If used on a PC, they must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failure, they must mark 2 Stress or take the deal.

features.name: The Best Muscle Money Can Buy
features.text: Once per scene, **mark a Stress** to summon **1d4+1** Tier 1 adversaries, who appear at Far range, to enforce the Baron's will.

name: Minotaur Wrecker
descr: A massive bull-headed firbolg with a quick temper.

features.name: Ramp Up
features.text: You must **spend a Fear** to spotlight the Minotaur. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

features.name: Charging Bull
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to charge through a group within Close range and make an attack against all targets in the Minotaur's path. Targets the Minotaur succeeds against take **2d6+8** physical damage and are knocked back to Very Far range. If a target is knocked into a solid object or another creature, they take an extra **1d6** damage (combine the damage).

features.name: Gore
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range, moving the Minotaur into Melee range of them. On a success, deal **2d8** direct physical damage.

name: Mortal Hunter
descr: An undead figure wearing a heavy leather coat, with searching eyes and a casually cruel demeanor.

features.name: Terrifying
features.text: When the Hunter makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Deathlock
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to curse a target within Very Close range with a necrotic *Deathlock* until the end of the scene. Attacks made by the Hunter against a *Deathlocked* target deal direct damage. The Hunter can only maintain one *Deathlock* at a time.

features.name: Inevitable Death
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to spotlight **1d4** allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

features.name: Rampage
features.text: Countdown (Loop **1d6**). When the Hunter is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, move the Hunter in a straight line to a point within Far range and make an attack against all targets in their path. Targets the Hunter succeeds against take **2d8+2** physical damage.

name: Royal Advisor
descr: A high-ranking courtier with the ear of the local nobility.

features.name: Devastating Retort
features.text: A PC who rolls less than 17 on an action roll targeting the Advisor must mark a Stress.

features.name: Bend Ears
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to influence an NPC within Melee range with whispered words. That target's opinion on one matter shifts toward the Advisor's preference unless it is in direct opposition to the target's motives.

features.name: Scapegoat
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to convince a crowd or notable individual that one person or group is responsible for some problem facing the target. The target becomes hostile to the scapegoat until convinced of their innocence with a successful Presence Roll (17).

name: Secret-keeper
descr: A clandestine leader with a direct channel to the Fallen Gods.

data.motivesAndTactics: Amass great power, plot, take command

features.name: Seize Your Moment
features.text: **Spend 2 Fear** to spotlight **1d4** allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

features.name: Our Master's Will
features.text: When you spotlight an ally within Far range, **mark a Stress** to gain a Fear.

features.name: Summoning Ritual
features.text: Countdown (6). When the Secret-Keeper is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When they mark HP, tick up this countdown by the number of HP marked. When it triggers, summon a Minor Demon who appears at Close range.

features.name: Fallen Hounds
features.text: Once per scene, when the Secret-Keeper marks 2 or more HP, you can **mark a Stress** to summon a Demonic Hound Pack, which appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.

name: Shark
descr: A large aquatic predator, always on the move.

data.motivesAndTactics: Find the blood, isolate prey, target the weak

features.name: Terrifying
features.text: When the Shark makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Rending Bite
features.text: When the Shark makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Blood in the Water
features.text: When a creature within Close range of the Shark marks HP from another creature's attack, you can **mark a Stress** to immediately spotlight the Shark, moving them into Melee range of the target and making a standard attack.

name: Siren
descr: A half-fish person with shimmering scales and an irresistible voice.

data.motivesAndTactics: Consume, lure prey, subdue with song

features.name: Captive Audience
features.text: If the Siren makes a standard attack against a target *Entranced* by their song, the attack deals **2d10+1** damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Enchanting Song
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to sing a song that affects all targets within Close range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or become *Entranced* until they mark 2 Stress. Other Sirens within Close range of the target can **mark a Stress** to each add a +1 bonus to the Difficulty of the reaction roll. While *Entranced*, a target can't act and is *Vulnerable*.

name: Spectral Archer
descr: A ghostly fighter with an ethereal bow, unable to move on while their charge is vulnerable.

data.motivesAndTactics: Move through solid objects, stay out of the fray, rehash old battles

features.name: Ghost
features.text: The Archer has resistance to physical damage. **Mark a Stress** to move up to Close range through solid objects.

features.name: Pick Your Target
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to make an attack within Far range against a PC who is within Very Close range of at least two other PCs. On a success, the target takes **2d8+12** physical damage.

name: Spectral Captain
descr: A ghostly commander leading their troops beyond death.

data.motivesAndTactics: Move through solid objects, rally troops, rehash old battles

features.name: Ghost
features.text: The Captain has resistance to physical damage. **Mark a Stress** to move up to Close range through solid objects.

features.name: Unending Battle
features.text: **Spend 2 Fear** to return up to **1d4+1** defeated Spectral allies to the battle at the points where they first appeared (with no marked HP or Stress).

features.name: Hold Fast
features.text: When the Captain's Spectral allies are forced to make a reaction roll, you can **mark a Stress** to give those allies a +2 bonus to the roll.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Captain makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Spectral Guardian
descr: A ghostly fighter with spears and swords, anchored by duty.

data.motivesAndTactics: Move through solid objects, protect treasure, rehash old battles

features.name: Ghost
features.text: The Guardian has resistance to physical damage. **Mark a Stress** to move up to Close range through solid objects.

features.name: Grave Blade
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal **2d10+6** physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

name: Spy
descr: A skilled espionage agent with a knack for being in the right place to overhear secrets.

data.motivesAndTactics: Cut and run, disguise appearance, eavesdrop

features.name: Gathering Secrets
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to describe how the Spy knows a secret about a PC in the scene.

features.name: Fly on the Wall
features.text: When a PC or group is discussing something sensitive, you can **mark a Stress** to reveal that the Spy is present in the scene, observing them. If the Spy escapes the scene to report their findings, you gain **1d4** Fear.

name: Stonewraith
descr: A prowling hunter, like a slinking mountain lion, with a slate-gray stone body.

features.name: Stonestrider
features.text: The Stonewraith can move through stone and earth as easily as air. While within stone or earth, they are *Hidden* and immune to all damage.

features.name: Rocky Ambush
features.text: While *Hidden*, **mark a Stress** to leap into Melee range with a target within Very Close range. The target must succeed on an Agility or Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take **2d8** physical damage and become temporarily *Restrained*.

features.name: Avalanche Roar
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to roar while within a cave and cause a cave-in. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take **2d10** physical damage. The rubble can be cleared with a Progress Countdown (8).

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Stonewraith makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: War Wizard
descr: A battle-hardened mage trained in destructive magic.

data.motivesAndTactics: Develop new spells, seek power, shatter formations

features.name: Battle Teleport
features.text: Before or after making a standard attack, you can **mark a Stress** to teleport to a location within Far range.

features.name: Refresh Warding Sphere
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to refresh the Wizard's "Warding Sphere" reaction.

features.name: Eruption
features.text: **Spend a Fear** and choose a point within Far range. A Very Close area around that point erupts into impassable terrain. All targets within that area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take **2d10** physical damage and are thrown out of the area. Targets who succeed take half damage and aren't moved.

features.name: Arcane Artillery
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to unleash a precise hail of magical blasts. All targets in the scene must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take **2d12** magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Warding Sphere
features.text: When the Wizard takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal **2d6** magic damage to the attacker. This reaction can't be used again until the Wizard refreshes it with their "Refresh Warding Sphere" action.

name: Adult Flickerfly
descr: A winged insect the size of a large house with iridescent scales and wings that move too fast to track.

data.motivesAndTactics: Collect shiny things, hunt, nest, swoop

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to four times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Never Misses
features.text: When the Flickerfly makes an attack, the target's Evasion is halved against the attack.

features.name: Deadly Flight
features.text: While flying, the Flickerfly can move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

features.name: Whirlwind
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to whirl, making an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Flickerfly succeeds against take **3d8** direct physical damage.

features.name: Mind Dance
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target's fears.

features.name: Hallucinatory Breath
features.text: Countdown (Loop **1d6**). When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail lose 2 Hope and take **3d8+3** direct magic damage.

features.name: Uncanny Reflexes
features.text: When the Flickerfly takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can **mark a Stress** to take half damage.

name: Demon Of Avarice
descr: A regal cloaked monstrosity with circular horns adorned with treasure.

features.name: Money Talks
features.text: Attacks against the Demon are made with disadvantage unless the attacker spends a handful of gold. This Demon starts with a number of handfuls equal to the number of PCs. When a target marks HP from the Demon's standard attack, they can spend a handful of gold instead of marking HP (1 handful per HP). Add a handful of gold to the Demon for each handful of gold spent by PCs on this feature.

features.name: Numbers Must Go Up
features.text: Add a bonus to the Demon's attack rolls equal to the number of handfuls of gold they have.

features.name: Money Is Time
features.text: **Spend 3 handfuls of gold (or a Fear)** to spotlight **1d4+1** allies.

name: Demon Of Despair
descr: A cloaked demon-creature with long limbs, seeping shadows.

data.motivesAndTactics: Make fear contagious, stick to the shadows, undermine resolve

features.name: Depths of Despair
features.text: The Demon deals double damage to PCs with 0 Hope.

features.name: Your Struggle Is Pointless
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to weigh down the spirits of all PCs within Far range. All targets affected replace their Hope Die with a **d8** until they roll a success with Hope or their next rest.

features.name: Your Friends Will Fail You
features.text: When a PC fails with Fear, you can **mark a Stress** to cause all other PCs within Close range to lose a Hope.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Demon Of Hubris
descr: A perfectly beautiful and infinitely cruel demon with a gleaming spear and elegant robes.

data.motivesAndTactics: Condescend, declare premature victory, prove superiority

features.name: Terrifying
features.text: When the Demon makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range must lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Double or Nothing
features.text: When a PC within Far range fails a roll, they can choose to reroll their Fear Die and take the new result. If they still fail, they mark 2 Stress and the Demon clears a Stress.

features.name: Unparalleled Skill
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to deal the Demon's standard attack damage to a target within Close range.

features.name: The Root of Villainy
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to spotlight two other Demons within Far range.

features.name: You Pale in Comparison
features.text: When a PC fails a roll within Close range of the Demon, they must mark a Stress.

name: Demon Of Jealousy
descr: A fickle creature of spindly limbs and insatiable desires.

data.motivesAndTactics: Join in on others' success, take what belongs to others, hold grudges

features.name: Unprotected Mind
features.text: The Demon's standard attack deals direct damage.

features.name: My Turn
features.text: When the Demon marks HP from an attack, **spend a number of Fear equal to the HP marked by the Demon** to cause the attacker to mark the same number of HP.

features.name: Rivalry
features.text: When a creature within Close range takes damage from a different adversary, you can **mark a Stress** to add a **d4** to the damage roll.

features.name: What's Yours Is Mine
features.text: When a PC takes Severe damage within Very Close range of the Demon, you can **spend a Fear** to cause the target to make a Finesse Reaction Roll. On a failure, the Demon seizes one item or consumable of their choice from the target's inventory.

name: Demon Of Wrath
descr: A hulking demon with boulder-sized fists, driven by endless rage.

data.motivesAndTactics: Fuel anger, impress rivals, wreak havoc

features.name: Anger Unrelenting
features.text: The Demon's attacks deal direct damage.

features.name: Battle Lust
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to boil the blood of all PCs within Far range. They use a **d20** as their Fear Die until the end of the scene.

features.name: Retaliation
features.text: When the Demon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can **mark a Stress** to make a standard attack against the attacker.

features.name: Blood and Souls
features.text: Countdown (Loop 6). Activate the first time an attack is made within sight of the Demon. It ticks down when a PC takes a violent action. When it triggers, summon **1d4** Minor Demons, who appear at Close range.

name: Dire Bat
descr: A wide-winged pet endlessly loyal to their vampire owner.

features.name: Flying
features.text: While flying, the Bat gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

features.name: Screech
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to send a high-pitch screech out toward all targets in front of the Bat within Far range. Those targets must mark **1d4** Stress.

features.name: Guardian
features.text: When an allied Vampire marks HP, you can **mark a Stress** to fly into Melee range of the attacker and make an attack with advantage against them. On a success, deal **2d6+2** physical damage.

name: Dryad
descr: A nature spirit in the form of a humanoid tree.

data.motivesAndTactics: Command, cultivate, drive out, preserve the forest

features.name: Bramble Patch
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to target a point within Far range. Create a patch of thorns that covers an area within Close range of that point. All targets within that area take **2d6+2** physical damage when they act. A target must succeed on a Finesse Roll or deal more than 20 damage to the Dryad with an attack to leave the area.

features.name: Grow Saplings
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to grow three Treant Sapling Minions, who appear at Close range and immediately take the spotlight.

features.name: We Are All One
features.text: When an ally dies within Close range, you can **spend a Fear** to clear 2 HP and 2 Stress as the fallen ally's life force is returned to the forest.

name: Elemental Spark
descr: A blazing mote of elemental fire.

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Elemental is defeated when they take any damage. For every 9 damage a PC deals to the Elemental, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Elemental Sparks within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Greater Earth Elemental
descr: A living landslide of boulders and dust, as large as a house.

features.name: Slow
features.text: When you spotlight the Elemental and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Elemental and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Crushing Blows
features.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Immovable Object
features.text: An attack that would move the Elemental moves them two fewer ranges (for example, Far becomes Very Close). When the Elemental takes physical damage, reduce it by 7.

features.name: Rockslide
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to create a rockslide that buries the land in front of Elemental within Close range with rockfall. All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (19). Targets who fail take **2d12+5** physical damage and become *Vulnerable* until their next roll with Hope. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

name: Greater Water Elemental
descr: A huge living wave that crashes down upon enemies.

features.name: Water Jet
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to attack a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal **2d4+7** physical damage and the target's next action has disadvantage. On a failure, the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Drowning Embrace
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against become *Restrained* and *Vulnerable* as they begin drowning. A target can break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll.

features.name: High Tide
features.text: When the Elemental makes a successful standard attack, you can **mark a Stress** to knock the target back to Close range.

name: Head Vampire
descr: A captivating undead dressed in aristocratic finery.

data.motivesAndTactics: Create thralls, charm, command, fly, intimidate

features.name: Terrifying
features.text: When the Vampire makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Look into My Eyes
features.text: A creature who moves into Melee range of the Vampire must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, you gain **1d4** Fear.

features.name: Feed on Followers
features.text: When the Vampire is within Melee range of an ally, they can cause the ally to mark a HP. The Vampire then clears a HP.

features.name: The Hunt Is On
features.text: **Spend 2 Fear** to summon **1d4** Vampires, who appear at Far range and immediately take the spotlight.

features.name: Lifesuck
features.text: When the Vampire is spotlighted, roll a **d8**. On a result of 6 or higher, all targets within Very Close range must mark a HP.

name: Huge Green Ooze
descr: A translucent green mound of acid taller than most humans.

features.name: Slow
features.text: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Acidic Form
features.text: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Envelop
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze Envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. While *Enveloped*, the target must mark an additional Stress every time they make an action roll. When the Ooze takes Severe damage, all *Enveloped* targets are freed and the condition is cleared.

features.name: Split
features.text: When the Ooze has 4 or more HP marked, you can **spend a Fear** to split them into two Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

name: Hydra
descr: A quadrupedal scaled beast with multiple long-necked heads, each filled with menacing fangs.

features.name: Many-Headed Menace
features.text: The Hydra begins with three heads and can have up to five. When the Hydra takes Major or greater damage, they lose a head.

features.name: Relentless
features.text: The Hydra can be spotlighted X times per GM turn, where X is the Hydra's number of heads. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Regeneration
features.text: If the Hydra has any marked HP, **spend a Fear** to clear a HP and grow two heads.

features.name: Terrifying Chorus
features.text: All PCs within Far range lose 2 Hope.

features.name: Magical Weakness
features.text: When the Hydra takes magic damage, they become *Dazed* until the next roll with Fear. While *Dazed*, they can't use their Regeneration action but are immune to magic damage.

name: Monarch
descr: The sovereign ruler of a nation, wreathed in the privilege of tradition and wielding unmatched power in their domain.

data.motivesAndTactics: Control vassals, destroy rivals, forge a legacy

features.name: Execute Them!
features.text: **Spend a Fear** per PC in the party to have the group condemned for crimes real or imagined. A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll can demand trial by combat or another special form of trial.

features.name: Crownsguard
features.text: Once per scene, **mark a Stress** to summon six Tier 3 Minions, who appear at Close range to enforce the Monarch's will.

features.name: Casus Belli
features.text: Long-Term Countdown (8). **Spend a Fear** to activate after the Monarch's desire for war is first revealed. When it triggers, the Monarch has a reason to rally the nation to war and the support to act on that reason. You gain **1d4** Fear.

name: Oak Treant
descr: A sturdy animate old-growth tree.

data.motivesAndTactics: Hide in plain sight, preserve the forest, root down, swing branches

features.name: Just a Tree
features.text: Before they make their first attack in a fight or after they become *Hidden*, the Treant is indistinguishable from other trees until they next act or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll to identify them.

features.name: Seed Barrage
features.text: Mark a **Stress** and make an attack against up to three targets within Close range, pummeling them with giant acorns. Targets the Treant succeeds against take **2d10+5** physical damage.

features.name: Take Root
features.text: Mark a **Stress** to *Root* the Treant in place. The Treant is *Restrained* while *Rooted*, and can end this effect instead of moving while they are spotlighted. While *Rooted*, the Treant has resistance to physical damage.

name: Treant Sapling
descr: A small, sentient tree sapling.

data.motivesAndTactics: Blend in, preserve the forest, pummel, surround

features.name: Minion
features.text: The Sapling is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Sapling, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.text: **Spend a Fear** to choose a target and spotlight all Treant Saplings within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 8 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

name: Vampire
descr: An intelligent undead with blood-stained lips and a predator's smile.

features.name: Draining Bite
features.text: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal **5d4** physical damage. A target who marks HP from this attack loses a Hope and must mark a Stress. The Vampire then clears a HP.
